str2: A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Singular
Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Approach, access, admission. From prosago; admission.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Feminine Singular
Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: To boast; I glory (exult) proudly. From some base akin to that of aucheo and euchomai; to vaunt.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Hope, expectation, trust, confidence. From a primary elpo; expectation or confidence.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
